Package model

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Stock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IstockModel
    public class Stock
extends java.lang.Object
implements IstockModel
    Stock class implements IstockModel interface. It contains all the data related a stock. Each stock will contain tickerName, the number of units, the date of transaction, the commission value (for flexible portfolios), the transaction price, and whether the stock is bought or sold. In our application we support NASDAQ top 50 stocks. So, only these 50 stocks will be available for purchasing or selling. The number of units of a particular stock is always integral, it cannot be fractional. If user provides fractional stocks, then our application throws an error. The transaction date for buying or selling a stock has to be no later than today's date. Commission value is specific to flexible portfolios. Each buy or sell transaction for a flexible portfolio needs a commission value. We take commission value in dollars. TransactionPrice is the price at which a stock is bought or sold. We get this data from the stock files. We update the stock files if the stock details doesn't exists in our stored file for the transaction date. The operation buyOrSell corresponds to weather the particular transaction is for buying a stock or selling a stock. This is always set to Operation.BUY for fixed portfolios.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stock

        public Stock​(java.lang.String tickerName,
             java.lang.Double numOfUnits,
             java.lang.Double commission,
             java.lang.Double transactionPrice,
             java.time.LocalDate transactionDate,
             Operation buyOrSell)
        Instantiates a new Stock. It takes in tickerName, num of units, commission value, the transaction price, the transaction date and whether the stock was bought or sold. The commission value is always set to 0 for fixed portfolios. The buyOrSell is set to Operation.BUY for fixed portfolios as we don't support selling of a stock for fixed portfolios.
        Parameters:
        tickerName - the ticker name
        numOfUnits - the num of units
        commission - the commission
        transactionPrice - the transaction price
        transactionDate - the transaction date
        buyOrSell - the buy or sell

    • Method Detail

      • getBuilder

        public static Stock.StockBuilder getBuilder()

        We use the builder method. It maintains copies of all the fields that would be required to build the stock object. It offers methods to edit each field individually, but maintains default values for all of them. A user would have to choose to call as few or as many of these methods to set the values of these fields. In the end the user can call a method in the builder that would take the set fields, create the stock object and return it.

        This method is particularly helpful in our application, because we have two types of stocks, one for fixed portfolios and the other for flexible portfolios. We don't require the fields like commission, buyOrSell for fixed portfolios, hence we set the default values for these fields for fixed portfolios using this builder method.

        Returns:
        the builder

      • getTickerName

        public java.lang.String getTickerName()
        Description copied from interface: IstockModel
        Method to get the NASDAQ ticker name of the stock. We support NASDAQ top 50 stocks in our application. If the entered tickerName is not present in the NASDAQ top 50 list, then we ask user to enter a valid supported tickerName.
        Specified by:
        getTickerName in interface IstockModel
        Returns:
        the ticker name of the calling stock object

      • getBuyOrSell

        public Operation getBuyOrSell()
        Description copied from interface: IstockModel
        This method is used to determine whether the stock is bought or sold. It returns Operation.BUY if the stock was bought and Operation.SELL if the stock was sold.
        Specified by:
        getBuyOrSell in interface IstockModel
        Returns:
        Operation.Buy or Operation.SELL
